H1.text: Changes to gas is what happens to water when it freezes.

H3.text: Changes volume is what happens to water when it freezes.

A4.text: When water freezes, it increases in volume (about 9% for fresh water).

A5.text: An unusual property of water is that its solid form—ice frozen at atmospheric pressure—is approximately 8.3% less dense than its liquid form; this is equivalent to a volumetric expansion of 9%スタッフ.
